results.content: Paid Parental Leave To be eligible for Capsule’s Paid Parental Leave, which consists of both bonding leave and disability leave1, a team member must meet all of the below requirements: ● You must be actively employed as a full-time team member and have actively worked for Capsule for at least six (6) consecutive months before the date of adoption, foster placement, or birth; ● You must submit proof of adoption, newly placed foster child, or birth. The date of adoption, placement, or birth will be the start date for Paid Parental Leave; ● Parental Leave must be used within twelve (12) months of the date of adoption, placement, or birth date; and ● Apply to all federal, state, or local agencies for statutory short-term disability and/or paid family leave benefits that you are eligible for and submit proof of: ○ An approved application; and ○ A confirmed benefit amount that you expect to receive directly from the agency. 1 This process is not required to apply solely for disability leave.

results.content: School Activity Leave Depending on your Capsule work location you, as a parent of one or more children, may be eligible for a leave to attend school or daycare activities. Please review your specific state addendum for details or contact peopleops@capsule.com for eligibility details. Capsule may request verification from the school within 48 hours of the leave end date. FMLA (Family and Medical Leave Act) If you have worked for Capsule for at least one year and for a minimum of 1250 hours over the period of 12 months, you are eligible to take up to 12 weeks of unpaid, job protected leave in a 12 month period under the FMLA. The full twelve (12) weeks must be used within the 12 month period.

results.content: financial and legal arrangements, attending counseling sessions, and attending post-deployment reintegration briefings The 12 month period used in calculating leave eligibility will be the 12 months rolling backward from the date of the desired FMLA leave. You must provide sufficient information to determine if a requested leave qualifies as an FMLA leave, including medical certification to support a request for leave due to a serious health condition. If you do not provide the medical information, your leave may not be granted and any absence may be considered unexcused. In certain circumstances, your leave could qualify for intermittent or a reduced work schedule. Leave taken intermittently and may be taken in increments of no less than one (1) hour. Capsule will continue to provide you with medical coverage under its group health plan provided that you pay your contributions to the plan’s cost during your leave. While on leave you will not accrue PTO or any other benefit.

results.content: The leave policies below are applicable for full-time team members. Part-time team members are not eligible for leave policies. Part-time team members may reach out to local state agencies to request a paid state leave. Part-time team members who go out on leave must report their approved state agency leave with their manager and peopleops@capsule.com. Capsule’s leave policies are meant to supplement federal and state leave programs. The People Team will help guide you through the leave process. If you are eligible for paid state leaves, you must apply to those agencies directly. Anticipated payments from state and local agencies will be subtracted from Capsule wage continuation so that you may earn up to, but not over, 100% of your base annual rate. Leaves can be taken concurrently so long as application of leaves do not conflict. All teammates should make their best efforts to give 30 days notice to peopleops@capsule.com prior to taking a foreseeable leave.

results.content: EAP (Employee Assistance Program) Capsule recognizes that all team members go through difficult times. Capsule provides a benefit for team members and their families to receive counseling at no cost beginning on the date of hire. The free counseling is limited to a maximum of five visits per year, per issue for you and your dependents on Capsule benefits. Additional counseling should be coordinated through your medical insurance plan. Leaves of Absence A leave of absence is a way for team members who are experiencing out-of-the-ordinary circumstances to take time off work. Common reasons are childbirth, adoption, caring for an ill family member, serious health conditions or military leave. PTO and paid sick leave and other leave accruals do not accrue while a team member is on a leave of absence, regardless of whether they receive any wage replacement payments. The leave policies below are applicable for full-time team members.

results.content: Capsule's Paid Parental Leave may be used continuously or intermittently, beginning on the day of the child’s birth, adoption, or placement date and expiring after twelve (12) months from your event date. Unless otherwise requested in the initial application for leave, Paid Parental Leave will be applied continuously. If applied intermittently, Paid Parental Leave may only be applied towards two (2) separate periods, and each period must be a minimum of four (4) weeks. Additionally, the start and end dates of each period must be submitted with the initial application for leave. Wage continuation will not be applied retroactively to any prior leave. Two parents of the same newborn child who both work for Capsule cannot go on Paid Parental Leave at the same time. Each parent who is eligible for Paid Parental Leave will be eligible at separate times within twelve (12) months of the birth or placement of a new child.

results.content: While on leave you will not accrue PTO or any other benefit. However, if you are entitled to sick pay or short-term disability payments, or if you have accrued paid time off you are required to use this time for any unpaid FMLA leave taken, to the extent permitted by law. Compensation and Benefits During FMLA Leave Accrued, unused PTO will be paid during FMLA leave at the team member’s request. After 30 days of continuous FMLA leave, team members may elect to continue their health plan coverage at their own expense, for up to 24 months or during the remaining period of service, whichever is shorter. Military Leave If you are a regular, full-time team member and enter full-time military service, you will be on military leave of absence without pay. Upon your return, will be provided job reinstatement and benefits as defined in the 1994 Veterans Reemployment Right Law. Full details of your military leave rights and obligations are available from the People Team.

results.content: Eligible team members are entitled on return from leave to be reinstated to their former position or an equivalent position with equivalent employment benefits, pay, and other terms and conditions of employment. Exceptions to this provision may apply if business circumstances have changed (e.g. if the team member’s position is no longer available due to a job elimination). Capsule will determine whether a position is an “equivalent position.” Exceptions also may apply for certain highly compensated team members under certain conditions. As a condition of restoration, each team member who has taken FMLA Medical Leave on account of his or her own serious health condition must provide a written certification from his or her health care provider that the team member is able to resume working, unless prohibited by law.

results.content: Returning to Work After Your Leave of Absence You cannot use PTO, DPTO, sick time, or unpaid time to extend your leave. If a team member does not return to work at the expiration of any leave of absence and has not requested or received an extension of leave, or received an extension of leave as a reasonable accommodation, the team member’s employment may be terminated. After you are expected to return, if you are absent for 3 consecutive days this is considered a voluntary resignation and Capsule has the right to separate employment. Upon termination of employment for any reason during Leave, team members are not eligible for payment of any unused Paid Parental Leave. This policy does not provide team members with any leave of absence entitlement, right to reinstatement, or continued medical benefits unless otherwise required by law.
